5288.verse: إِنَّا|Indeed, We|96|107|120$بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ|have tried them|125|147|17169$كَمَا|as|53|75|110$بَلَوْنَآ|We tried|76|98|17170$أَصْحَـٰبَ|(the) companions|136|158|4057$ٱلْجَنَّةِ|(of) the garden,|127|138|778$إِذْ|when|55|100|1198$أَقْسَمُواْ|they swore|94|184|5052$لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا|to pluck its fruit|126|216|17171$مُصْبِحِينَ|(in the) morning,|131|176|9817$

5290.verse: فَطَافَ|So there came|117|139|17173$عَلَيْهَا|upon it|69|113|1269$طَآئِفٌ|a visitation|93|137|7105$مِّن|from|50|94|53$رَّبِّكَ|your Lord,|87|131|1322$وَهُمْ|while they|88|110|256$نَآئِمُونَ|were asleep.|104|104|6633$

5292.verse: فَتَنَادَوْاْ|And they called one another|208|386|17176$مُصْبِحِينَ|(at) morning,|110|288|9817$

5297.verse: فَلَمَّا|But when|82|104|141$رَأَوْهَا|they saw it,|100|144|17186$قَالُوٓاْ|they said,|86|130|101$إِنَّا|`Indeed, we|102|146|120$لَضَآلُّونَ|(are) surely lost.|131|153|17187$

5299.verse: قَالَ|Said|52|71|309$أَوْسَطُهُمْ|(the) most moderate of them,|219|257|17188$أَلَمْ|`Did not|75|113|348$أَقُل|I tell|52|90|349$لَّكُمْ|you,|51|89|207$لَوْلَا|`Why not|84|103|1090$تُسَبِّحُونَ|you glorify (Allah)?``|160|160|17189$

5301.verse: فَأَقْبَلَ|Then approached,|140|164|14624$بَعْضُهُمْ|some of them|110|159|736$عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ|to others|128|177|17190$يَتَلَـٰوَمُونَ|blaming each other.|151|175|17191$

5302.verse: قَالُواْ|They said,|89|111|101$يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ|`O woe to us!|114|158|11736$إِنَّا|Indeed, we|94|138|120$كُنَّا|[we] were|88|132|4361$طَـٰغِينَ|transgressors.|114|136|14596$

5304.verse: كَذَٲلِكَ|Such|77|84|702$ٱلْعَذَابُ‌ۖ|(is) the punishment.|154|169|827$وَلَعَذَابُ|And surely the punishment|196|211|9480$ٱلْأَخِرَةِ|(of) the Hereafter|139|154|978$أَكْبَرُ‌ۚ|(is) greater,|100|107|1897$لَوْ|if|41|159|905$كَانُواْ|they|69|306|94$يَعْلَمُونَ|know.|92|210|115$

5306.verse: أَفَنَجْعَلُ|Then will We treat|142|214|17193$ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ|the Muslims|109|253|6229$كَٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ|like the criminals?|136|208|17194$

5311.verse: سَلْهُمْ|Ask them,|86|132|17196$أَيُّهُم|which of them|114|207|2859$بِذَٲلِكَ|for that|72|165|15476$زَعِيمٌ|(is) responsible.|125|171|9173$

5313.verse: يَوْمَ|(The) Day|87|102|1057$يُكْشَفُ|will be uncovered|135|166|17197$عَن|from|54|85|1105$سَاقٍ|the shin|73|104|17198$وَيُدْعَوْنَ|and they will be called|168|199|17199$إِلَى|to|53|68|118$ٱلسُّجُودِ|prostrate,|93|188|1151$فَلَا|but not|69|259|208$يَسْتَطِيعُونَ|they will be able,|133|228|2457$

5287.verse: We will brand him upon the snout.

5288.verse: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning

5290.verse: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.

5291.verse: And it became as though reaped.

5292.verse: And they called one another at morning,

5293.verse: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."

5294.verse: So they set out, while lowering their voices,

5295.verse: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."

5296.verse: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.

5297.verse: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;

5299.verse: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "

5300.verse: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

5301.verse: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.

5302.verse: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.

5303.verse: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."

5304.verse: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

5305.verse: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.

5306.verse: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?

5307.verse: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?

5308.verse: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn

5309.verse: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

5310.verse: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?

5311.verse: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

5312.verse: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.

5313.verse: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
